casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Tae Kwon HAMMONDS. No. 389A15-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 31, 2016. Joseph E. Elder, Assistant Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. Anne M. Gomez, Assistant Appellate Defender, for Hammonds, Tae Kwon. John R. Rittelmeyer, Raleigh, for Disability Rights North Carolina, et al. Anne Bleyman, for Disability Rights North Carolina, et al. Trey Robison, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 30th of March 2016 by Disability Rights North Carolina, North Carolina's Protection and Advocacy system, and North Carolina Advocates for Justice for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 31st of March 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
